post.body: Trying to scroll a web page down using fingers on laptop's touchscreen. Now I have lots of fingertip fat stains spread around my screen...
Using ctrl+Enter to post here on ZeroMe would be verey nice.
Is there a way of accessing my ZeroNet process running on my laptop through the browser of my cellphone?

Now, for a very interesting esoteric programming language: Piet.

http://www.dangermouse.net/esoteric/piet.html

Here is a program that prints "Hi":

In 2018 you can REUSE your old calendar from 2007 or 2001.

:)

Reading about MaidSafe Network (man, it's 1:03 in the "morning". I should be sleeping...).

Nice things:
1) They are using Rust. Yeah, I like Rust.
2) No need to download a blockchain to use it (as a Client, at least).

MAYBE interesting things, at least as proofs of concepts:
1) Clients and Vaults are different things;
2) They have a browser. Not that much of a feature, since it looks like an old Chromium "in disguise" (and somehow uglier).
3) The "Authenticator" thing, that is something I was planning to suggest on ZeroNet. It's not as ZeroID and related "zites". It would be a way to store and access securely my private keys from the network itself.

Bad things:
1) Cryptocurrency! MAN, I'm supposed to have a "small ammount" of SafeCoin to simply host my website, even if my machine already is itself a "Vault" (that is: I AM collaborating actively with the network). (At least is what I got from the "paper").
2) They are LA-A-TE! Man, +7 years, already...
3) Everyone seems to be looking for a solution for a problem that maybe doesn't even exist: people willing to give part of their hard drives and computing power to host other peoples content. Isn't that reasonably solved here at ZeroNet? I host a lot of content simply because, well, I BELIEVE. Absolutely no need to pay me no "ZeroNetCoins", thanks.

Just watched last episode of X-Files. It's about some of the craziness of IoT and corporate/government surveillance.
I liked it.

Yay! Income taxes declaration done (I live in Brazil)!
Man, it's such a relief to finish soon this thing...

Blockstack = SHIT.

How do I know?
It started and then opened a new tab in my browser with **my password** in the query parameters (that is: ABSOUTELY OPEN and visible in the URL bar).

I'm lucky there was no one to see it.
Now I even have to clean the entry from browsing history.

Man, HOW can anyone let this happen???

I'm not touching this thing anymore.

公正党 (just party) invaded ZeroMedium.

If I'm going hard on these alternative networks maybe it'd be nice to learn Mandarin after all...

Interesting:

https://www.crypto101.io/

(The button to get the PDF is "download-direct-no-view-in-browser-sorry").

Zapping  channels on TV, **trap movie** found: Pacific Rim.

Result: watching again, with my wife. For the Nth time.

comment.body: @Test20180221: Haha! No. Just sharing weird nasty small personal things.
@Test20180221: Bash script? Where's the fun on that?
Oh, and the title of the episode is `Rm9sbG93ZXJz`, that is "Followers" in base64 encoding. The tagline is `VGhlIFRydXRoIGlzIE91dCBUaGVyZQ=`.
I say "invaded" not as a bad term, of course. The guy just created a lot of articles there, as anyone can (and is even invited to) do.
@Version: I like ZeroNet very much. But I delved recently into the code and found a lot of vulnerabilities I intend to explore more deeply into a nice article I want to write in a few days.
